skill.name: finishing-a-development-branch
skill.description: Use when implementation is complete, all tests pass, and you need to decide how to integrate the work - guides completion of development work by presenting structured options for merge, PR, or cleanup
skill.summary: Use when implementation is complete, all tests pass, and you need to decide how to integrate the wor...
skill.author: obra

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code, network calls, or filesystem access. The SKILL.md file contains only structured instructions for AI behavior. All git operations described would be executed by the AI's existing capabilities, not by this skill directly.

content.value_statement: After implementation is complete and tests pass, this skill guides you through the final steps of your work. It presents clear options for merging, creating a PR, keeping the branch for later, or discarding the work entirely.
actual_capabilities: Verifies tests pass before presenting options
Determines the base branch from which the feature branch split
Presents four structured options: merge locally, create PR, keep branch, or discard
Executes the chosen workflow with proper cleanup
Confirms before discarding work to prevent accidental deletion
limitations: Assumes the project has a test suite configured
Does not handle merge conflicts automatically
Requires user to select one of the four predefined options

use_cases.title: Complete feature development
use_cases.description: After finishing a feature branch, get guided through merging, PR creation, or cleanup

use_cases.title: Finalize reviewed work
use_cases.description: When a feature is approved, cleanly merge it to the main branch and clean up

use_cases.title: Structure branch completion
use_cases.description: AI agents can use this skill to systematically finish development work

prompt_templates.title: Basic completion
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the finishing-a-development-branch skill to complete this work

prompt_templates.title: After tests pass
prompt_templates.prompt: All implementation tasks are complete. Apply the finishing-a-development-branch workflow to finish up

prompt_templates.title: Merge to main
prompt_templates.prompt: This feature is ready. Guide me through merging to main using the finishing-a-development-branch skill

prompt_templates.title: Clean up worktree
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to clean up this worktree. Use the finishing-a-development-branch skill to finish the branch properly

output_examples.input: Use the finishing-a-development-branch skill to complete this work
output: Implementation complete. What would you like to do?
2. Push and create a Pull Request
3. Keep the branch as-is (I'll handle it later)

best_practices: Always announce you are using the skill at the start of the conversation
Never proceed with merge or PR if tests are failing
Require explicit confirmation before discarding work
Only cleanup worktrees for Options 1 and 4, not for Option 3
anti_patterns: Skipping test verification before presenting options
Using open-ended questions instead of the four structured options
Automatically cleaning up worktrees without checking if they should be kept

faq.question: What happens if tests fail?
faq.answer: The skill stops and reports the test failures. You must fix them before proceeding with any merge or PR option.

faq.question: Can I customize the four options?
faq.answer: No. The skill presents exactly these four options to ensure consistent, safe behavior across all uses.

faq.question: Does this skill work with GitHub CLI?
faq.answer: Yes. Option 2 uses gh pr create to push the branch and create a pull request automatically.

faq.question: Is my work safe if I choose to discard?
faq.answer: The skill requires you to type 'discard' to confirm. This prevents accidental deletion of your commits.

faq.question: What if my branch is not based on main or master?
faq.answer: The skill tries main first, then master. You can also specify the correct base branch manually if needed.

faq.question: How is this different from a manual git workflow?
faq.answer: This skill provides a structured, step-by-step process that prevents common mistakes like merging with failing tests or accidentally deleting work.
